benchmark_details.name: IndusGCC (Industrial General Computer Control)
benchmark_details.overview: IndusGCC is the first dataset and benchmark tailored to Large Language Model-based General Computer Control in industrial environments, encompassing 448 real-world tasks across seven domains, aimed at automating GUI-based operations.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a dataset and evaluation framework for automating GUI-based operations in industrial environments using large language models.

data.source: Real-world interactions from operational industrial systems across seven domains.
data.annotation: Manual annotation of mouse clicks, keyboard inputs, and task descriptions synchronized with screen recordings.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the functional equivalence and structural alignment of control scripts generated by LLMs compared to gold-standard references.
methodology.interpretation: Higher values in metrics indicate better performance in accurately reproducing intended operational tasks.
methodology.validation: Performance is benchmarked against mainstream LLMs using the proposed evaluation framework.
